\( \def\curl#1{\text{curl }#1} \def\bracket#1{\left({#1}\right)} \def\sbracket#1{\left[{#1}\right]} %square bracket \def\cbracket#1{\left\{{#1}\right\}} %curly bracket \def\Lim_#1{{\lim\limits_{#1}}} \def\limit{{\lim\limits_{n \to \infty}}} \def\dsum{{\displaystyle \sum}} \def\Sum_#1^#2{{\sum\limits_{#1}^#2}} \def\summ{\sum\limits_{n=0}^{\infty}} \def\R{{\mathbb R}} \def\N{{\mathbb N}} \def\fQ{{\mathcal{Q}}} \def\riemannR{{\mathscr{R}}} \def\ep{\varepsilon} \def\d{\displaystyle} \def\grad{\nabla} \def\q{q} \def\mod#1{\left | {#1} \right |} \def\abs#1{\left | {#1} \right |} \def\crossProduct#1{\left\|\begin{array}{ccc} #1 \end{array}\right\|} \newcommand{\partialwrt}[2][]{\frac{\partial {#1}}{\partial {#2}}} \newcommand{\dpartialwrt}[2][]{\dfrac{\partial {#1}}{\partial {#2}}} \def\upint{\mkern3mu\overline{\vphantom{\intop}\mkern7mu}\mkern-20mu\int} \def\lowint{\mkern3mu\underline{\vphantom{\intop}\mkern7mu}\mkern-10mu\int} \def\lowsup_#1{_{{\lower{0.3em}{#1}}}} \)
  • Home
  • analysis
  • ch07
  • theorems
  • theorem-7-10.html

Suppose $\{f_n\}$ is a sequence of functions defined on $E$, and suppose $\abs{f_n(x)} \leq M_n \ (x\in E, n=1,2,3, \dots)$

Then $\sum f_n$ converges uniformly on $E$ if $\sum M_n$ converges.

Let $\{s_n\}$ be the sequence of the partial sums defined by $\Sum_{i=1}^{n} f_i(x) = s_n(x)$.

$$\begin{align*} n > m &\mbox{ implies } & \abs{s_n(x) - s_m(x)} &= \abs{\Sum_{i=1}^{n} f_i(x) - \Sum_{i=1}^{m} f_i(x)} \\ &&&= \abs{\Sum_{i=m+1}^{n} f_i(x)} \\ n > m &\mbox{ implies }& \abs{s_n(x) - s_m(x)} &\leq \Sum_{i=m+1}^n \abs{f_i(x)}\\ n > m, x \in E &\mbox{ implies }& \abs{s_n(x) - s_m(x)} &\leq \Sum_{i=m+1}^{n} M_i \end{align*}$$

Since $\sum M_n$ converges, by Theorem 3.22, for any $\ep > 0 $, there exists integer $N$ such that

$$\begin{align*} n \geq m \geq N \mbox{ implies that } \abs{\sum_{i=m}^n M_i} &\leq \ep\\ \abs{s_n(x) - s_m(x)} \leq \Sum_{i=m+1}^{n} M_i \leq \sum_{i=m}^n M_i &\leq \ep \end{align*}$$ $$n \geq m \geq N, x \in E \mbox{ implies } \abs{s_n(x) - s_m(x)} \leq \ep $$

Hence by Theorem 7.8 the sequence $\{s_n\}$ converges uniformly. Since sequence of partial sums converge uniformly, $\sum f_n$ converges uniformly.
